Question
========

A variable A is normally distributed according to N(μ,σ^²^). We draw a sample of size *n* from this distribution, with mean
$\bar{x}$ and sd s. Then it follows that the quantity $\frac{\bar{A}-\mu
}{\frac{s}{\sqrt{n}}}$ the following distribution:

Answerlist
----------

* N(0,1), the standard normal distribution
* T[n], the T-distribution with n degrees of freedom
* T[n-1], the T-distribution with n-1 degrees of freedom
* N(μ,σ²), the normal distribution with mean μ and variance σ²

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* N(0,1), the standard normal distribution: Incorrect
* T[n], the T distribution with n degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* T[n-1], the T distribution with n-1 degrees of freedom: Correct
* N(μ,σ²), the normal distribution with mean μ and variance σ²: Incorrect
